refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns a decoded MIME field on success, or &false; if an error occurs during the decoding.

mode determines the behaviour in the event iconv_mime_decode encounters a malformed MIME header field. You can specify any combination of the following bitmasks.
Bitmasks acceptable to iconv_mime_decode
Value Constant Description
1 ICONV_MIME_DECODE_STRICT
If set, the given header is decoded in full conformance with the standards defined in RFC2047. This option is disabled by default because there are a lot of broken mail user agents that don't follow the specification and don't produce correct MIME headers.
2 ICONV_MIME_DECODE_CONTINUE_ON_ERROR
If set, iconv_mime_decode attempts to continue to process the given header even though an error occurs.
The optional charset parameter specifies the character set to represent the result by. If omitted, iconv.internal_charset will be used.

example.title: iconv_mime_decode example
example.programlisting:
<?php
// This yields "Subject: Prüfung Prüfung"
echo iconv_mime_decode("Subject: =?UTF-8?B?UHLDvGZ1bmcgUHLDvGZ1bmc=?=",
                       0, "ISO-8859-1");
?>

refsect1.para: See also iconv_mime_decode_headers, imap_base64_decode, and imap_qprint.
